intro: Phoradendron larense, commonly known as the Larense mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant relies on its host for water and nutrients, while it provides some ecological benefits by offering shelter to birds and insects. Its seeds are dispersed by birds that eat its fleshy, red berries, contributing to its propagation and distribution.
